moves.1... d5 2. Bg2: Nf3 is slightly better, according to the chess database.
moves.3... Bd6 4. O-O Nf6 5. d3 O-O 6. Bg5: The database prefers Nbd2, though I see nothing wrong with this.
moves.6... Be7 7. Ne5:
Viccavdo vs. Rainster, Viccavdo played Nbd2 here, ultimately defeating Rainster.

http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=16640162&mv=12&rnd=0.45545266830871034
Nice.  I wasn't sure at first why white moved the queen, but this simultaneously attacks Pe6 & Pa7.  Black must choose which to lose.
moves.25... e5 26. Qd2: ?  Why not QxPa7?  Juicy pawn ripe for the plucking.  Black wasn't attacking anything.
moves.26... e4 27. f3 Qb6+ 28. Kf1 exf3 29. ex: Here Pc6 is vulnerable, by either the queen or the bishop.
moves.33... Qd8 34. Qd5 Qf6 35. Qe5 Qf8 36. Qb: White's queen is potentially pinned against his king with this blunder.  Qe6 would cost white a pawn, possibly two, but improve odds for the end game.
